sentences.en: Because of his irresolute character, we were defeated at last.
sentences.cn: 因为他性格的软弱, 我们最终被打败了.

sentences.en: Being aimless and irresolute and hesitant is lamentable mentality.
sentences.cn: 毫无理想而又优柔寡断是一种可悲的心理.

sentences.en: He is never irresolute or inactive.
I stood irresolute beside my car.
sentences.cn: 我犹豫不决地站在我的车旁。
优柔寡断的人不会成为好领袖.
优柔寡断的人不会成为胜利者.

sentences.en: Lacking firmness of will, character, or purpose ; irresolute.
sentences.cn: 犹豫不决的特性; 缺乏坚定的决心.

sentences.en: One must be decisive, not irresolute.
sentences.cn: 做事要当机立断, 不能久拖不决.

sentences.en: Presley was a confirmed dreamer, irresolute, inactive, with a strong tendency to melancholy.
sentences.cn: 普瑞斯莱是个不可救药的梦想家, 优柔寡断, 喜静厌动, 常常会觉得郁郁不乐.

sentences.en: The committee was timid and mediocre and irresolute.
sentences.cn: 委员会胆小、平庸、犹豫不决.

sentences.en: The irresolute spend the most precious moments of life regretting.
sentences.cn: 犹豫迟疑的人,常把生命最珍贵的时刻浪费在懊悔上.
那个经理是个优柔寡断的人.

sentences.en: The worst reason to launch an attack would be a fear of seeming irresolute.
sentences.cn: 因为担心看上去缺乏决断力就发动攻击，这是最糟糕的理由。

sentences.en: To be irresolute when a prompt decision should be taken would only spell disaster.
To be nervously irresolute in acting or doing.
sentences.cn: 不知所措在表演或做事时处于紧张犹豫中.

trans.tran_cn: 犹豫不定的，无决断的，憧，迟疑不决
trans.tran_en: unable to decide what to do
